com.thomsonreuters.corptech.charts

Interface AxisLayout

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataFittingAxisLayout

    public interface AxisLayout

    An axis layout is used to calcualte the default data transform for an axis. It is provided with the enclosing range (min, max) of all series in the axis (assuming that all series use the same units).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DataTransform calculateTransform(ContinuousAxis axis, Range dataRange, double screenLength, DataTransform renderTransform)
      Calculate layout transform for the axis

    • Method Detail

      • calculateTransform

        DataTransform calculateTransform(ContinuousAxis axis,
                                 Range dataRange,
                                 double screenLength,
                                 DataTransform renderTransform)

        Calculate layout transform for the axis

        Parameters:
        axis - Axis requiring layout
        dataRange - Data range for all series associated with the axis
        screenLength - Length of the axis, in screen co-ordinates
        renderTransform - Current offset transform (i.e. transform caused by panning and zooming).
        Returns:
        The result.
